name: UICollectionViewDataSource
desc: The methods adopted by the object you use to manage data and provide cells for a collection view.

items.name: func collectionView(UICollectionView, numberOfItemsInSection: Int) -> Int
items.desc: Asks your data source object for the number of items in the specified section.

items.name: func numberOfSections(in: UICollectionView) -> Int
items.desc: Asks your data source object for the number of sections in the collection view.

items.name: func collectionView(UICollectionView, cellForItemAt: IndexPath) -> UICollectionViewCell
items.desc: Asks your data source object for the cell that corresponds to the specified item in the collection view.

items.name: func collectionView(UICollectionView, viewForSupplementaryElementOfKind: String, at: IndexPath) -> UICollectionReusableView
items.desc: Asks your data source object to provide a supplementary view to display in the collection view.

items.name: func collectionView(UICollectionView, canMoveItemAt: IndexPath) -> Bool
items.desc: Asks your data source object whether the specified item can be moved to another location in the collection view.

items.name: func collectionView(UICollectionView, moveItemAt: IndexPath, to: IndexPath)
items.desc: Tells your data source object to move the specified item to its new location.

items.name: func indexTitles(for: UICollectionView) -> [String]?
items.desc: Asks the data source to return the titles for the index items to display for the collection view.

items.name: func collectionView(UICollectionView, indexPathForIndexTitle: String, at: Int) -> IndexPath
items.desc: Asks the data source to return the index path of a collection view item that corresponds to one of your index entries.
